title: The Harmonist’s Gamble
outcome: On the heels of halted repression, Harmonists propose restoring services citywide—but only if protesting districts agree to a public negotiation. Halden Zones draft their own ‘reverse oath,’ calling for accountability and a path to dismantling the BCI. Oksana and Lenart covertly support a citywide blackout. During talks, Halden’s old recording, warning of a moral reckoning, leaks citywide. The Council is forced to debate Stenograd’s future in public, with the people as witnesses and judges.

events.description: Harmonists announce full service restoration to all districts if protest zones agree to participate in a citywide negotiation regarding the BCI’s future.
Residents in Halden Zones present their own terms: a public acknowledgment of BCI abuses and the chance to debate dismantling it. Large assemblies form across Stenograd to witness the talks.
Oksana and Lenart help orchestrate a covert communications blackout during key negotiations, preventing any manipulative interference from the BCI or Council hardliners.
Negotiation livestream is interrupted by a never-heard Halden recording, warning about the dangers of unchecked systems and foreshadowing needed change. It galvanizes public demands for real reform.
After weeks of debate and protest, the Council agrees to a binding citywide vote. Stenograd’s forced choice over the BCI marks an unprecedented show of direct democracy.
